Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Help with summary!!!" (#1889) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello everyone!!
I'm using the library for work, in the following way:
Different processes create different documents. The first process creates a summary.
A the end, I merge all the documents and I would like to update the summary post-merge with all the new titles and pages.

As far as I know, there is no such functionality in the API.
I also tried to go through the merged document and to search for titles and corresponding pages, but I cannot get the page number (I cannot a function that does that).
Any suggestions? Any help? Thank you!!!

(Putting in macros does not help, because the final output is a .pdf file.)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Update CHANGELOG.md for 3.3" (#1887) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Can't open excel workbooks on one machine" (#1886) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**

On one machine the following code fails for all excel workbooks.

```
using var stream = new FileStream(...);
using var document = SpreadsheetDocument.Open(stream, isEditable: true);
Debug.Assert(document.WorkbookPart != null);
```
Same code and workbooks work fine on other machines.
Even an empty workbook like this fails:
[Blankreport.xlsx](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19085726/Blankreport.xlsx)

**Observed behavior**
document.WorkbookPart is null. No other error messages or exceptions.

**Expected behavior**
document.WorkbookPart should contain data.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows Server 2022 Datacenter
 - Office version: No office installed
 - .NET Target: 8.0.10
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 3.2.0 but have also tried several older versions, both 2.x and 3.x
In a very old version (2.7.2) I got an exception instead
> OpenXmlPackageException: The specified package is invalid. The main part is missing.

**Additional context**
Have verified the file is not altered by e.g. antivirus
i.e.
```
using var stream = new FileStream(...);
using var tostream = new FileStream(...);
stream.CopyTo(tostream);
```
creates identical file.
